text: Kipkemboi Kimeli (November 30, 1966 – February 6, 2010) was a Kenyan long- distance runner who won the bronze medal in the 10,000 metres at the 1988 Seoul Olympics. Kimeli died in Albuquerque, New Mexico from complications from pneumonia and tuberculosis on February 6, 2010. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1985 |World Cross Country Championships |Lisbon, Portugal |bgcolor="gold"| 1st |Junior race | |- |1988 |Olympic Games |Seoul, South Korea |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |10,000 m | |- |rowspan=2|1989 |rowspan=2|World Cross Country Championships |rowspan=2|Stavanger, Norway | 8th |Long race | |- |bgcolor="gold"| 1st |Team | |} ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1966 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Kenyan male long-distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:21st-century deaths from tuberculosis Category:Kenyan expatriates in the United States Category:Olympic athletes of Kenya Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Kenya Category:Place of birth missing Category:Olympic bronze medalists in athletics (track and field) Category:Kenyan male cross country runners Category:Medalists at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Infectious disease deaths in New Mexico Category:Tuberculosis deaths in New Mexico
title: Kipkemboi Kimeli
